intro: Conyza gallianii, commonly known as the hairy conyza, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Conyza gallianii is often considered a weed but can serve as a food source for certain insects.
